English: Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him, lest they should be put out <of the synagogue>:
Basque: Halaz guztiz, askok, baita buruzagietakoek ere, sinetsi zuten harengan; baina, fariseuen beldurrez, ez zuten agerian aitortzen, <judu-elkartetik> bota ez zitzaten;

English: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise <of God>.
Basque: izan ere, giza ohorea maiteago zuten <Jainkoarengandik> datorrena baino.

English: And supper being ended, the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray him; Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he was come <from God>, and went to God;
Basque: Deabruak Simon Iskarioteren seme Judasi sartua zion buruan Jesus saltzeko asmoa. Jesusek bazekien dena bere esku jarri ziola Aitak, eta <Jainkoarengandik> etorria zela eta Jainkoarengana zihoala.

English: He riseth <from supper>, and laid aside his garments; and took a towel, and girded himself.
Basque: <mahaitik jaiki>, soingainekoa erantzi eta, eskuzapia harturik, gerrian lotu zuen.

English: But that the world may know that I love the Father; and as the Father gave me commandment, even so I do. Arise, let us go <hence>.
Basque: baina munduak jakin behar du nik Aita maite dudala eta hark agindua zintzo betetzen dudala. Jaiki, goazen <hemendik>!

English: If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out <of the world>, therefore the world hateth you.
Basque: Mundukoak bazinete, munduak maite izango zintuzkete, nork berea maite duen bezala; baina nik aukeratu eta <mundutik atera zintuztedanez>, munduak gorroto dizue, mundukoak ez zaretelako.

English: And ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me <from the beginning>.
Basque: Eta zuek ere egingo duzue testigantza, <hasieratik> nirekin egon baitzarete.

English: They shall put you out <of the synagogue>: yea, the time cometh, that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service.
Basque: Zeren eta <judu-elkartetik> bota egingo baitzaituztete; are gehiago, badator ordua, zuek hilko zaituztenak Jainkoari kultu ematen diola uste izango duena.

English: And these things I said not unto you <at the beginning>, because I was with you.
Basque: «Ez nizuen hori <hasieratik esan>, ni zuekin nengoelako.

English: Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;
Basque: zuzentasunari buruz, Aitarengana noalako, <zuen artetik> desagertuz;
remarks: The ABL marker is added to a spatial postpositon.

English: He shall glorify me: for he shall receive <of mine>, and shall shew it unto you.
Basque: Berak nire Jainko-aintza azalduko du, adieraziko dizuena <niregandik> hartuko baitu.

English: [15] All things that the Father hath are mine: therefore said I, that he shall take <of mine>, and shall shew it unto you.
Basque: Aitak duen oro nirea da. Horregatik esan dizuet Espirituak <niregandik> hartuko duela adieraziko dizuena.

English: For the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out <from God>.
Basque: zeren Aitak berak maite baitzaituzte, ni maite izan nauzuelako eta <Jainkoarengandik> etorri naizela sinetsi duzuelako.

English: I came forth <from the Father>, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.
Basque: <Aitarengandik irten> eta mundura etorri nintzen; orain mundua utzi eta berriro Aitarengana noa».

English: Now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest forth <from God>.
Basque: Ziur dakigu orain dena dakizula eta ez duzula inork galdetu beharrik; honengatik sinesten dugu <Jainkoarengandik> etorri zarela.

English: Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is now come, that ye shall be scattered, <every man to his own>, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.
Basque: Hara, badator ordua –hobeto esan, heldua da–, <nor bere aldetik> sakabanatu eta bakarrik utziko nauzuena. Baina ni ez nago bakarrik, nirekin baitago Aita.

English: I have manifested thy name unto the men which thou gavest me out <of the world>: thine they were, and thou gavest them me; and they have kept thy word.
Basque: Eman diet zure berri <mundutik> bereizi eta eman zenizkidan gizon-emakumeei. Zureak ziren, zuk neuri eman zenizkidan, eta hauek onartu dute zure mezua.

English: Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are <of thee>.
Basque: Badakite orain zuk eman didazun guztia <zuregandik datorrela>

English: For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me; and they have received them, and have known surely that I came out <from thee>, and they have believed that thou didst send me.
Basque: Niri eman dizkidazun irakatsiak eman dizkiet nik, eta hauek onartu egin dituzte. Eta benetan dakite <zuregandik> etorri naizela, baita sinetsi ere zuk bidali nauzula.

English: I pray not <that thou shouldest take them out of the world>, but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil.
Basque: Ez dizut eskatzen <mundutik ateratzeko>, Gaiztoarengandik babesteko baizik.

English: I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou shouldest keep them <from the evil>.
Basque: Ez dizut eskatzen mundutik ateratzeko, <Gaiztoarengandik> babesteko baizik.

English: That the saying might be fulfilled, which he spake, <Of them which thou gavest me> have I lost none.
Basque: Horrela bete zen Jesusek berak esana: «<Eman dizkidazunetatik> ez dut bat ere galdu».

English: Then led they Jesus <from Caiaphas unto the hall of judgment>: and it was early; and they themselves went not into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled; but that they might eat the passover.
Basque: <Kaifasenetik gobernariaren jauregira> eraman zuten Jesus. Goizaldea zen. Judu-agintariak ez ziren sartu jauregira, ez kutsatzeko, ezin izango baitzuten bestela Pazko-afarian parte hartu.
remarks: In Basque English 'From X's' (meaning house) is expressed by the agglutination of ABL to the GEN.

English: And he bearing his cross went forth into a place called the place of a skull, which is called in the Hebrew Golgotha:
Basque: eta hau, gurutzea lepoan zuela, <hiritik> «Burezur» –hebreeraz Golgota– zeritzan tokirantz irten zen.

English: This title then read many of the Jews: for the place where Jesus was crucified was <nigh to the city>: and it was written in Hebrew, and Greek, and Latin.
Basque: Judu askok irakurri zuen kartela, <hiritik hurbil> baitzegoen Jesus gurutziltzatu zuten lekua; gainera, hebreeraz, latinez eta grekoz zegoen idatzia.

English: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also his coat: now the coat was without seam, <woven from the top throughout>.
Basque: Soldaduek, Jesus gurutziltzatu ondoren, haren jantziak hartu eta lau zati egin zituzten, bakoitzarentzat bana; gero tunika hartu zuten, baina josturarik gabea zenez, <goitik behera ehundua>,

English: The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day, (for that sabbath day was an high day,) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.
Basque: Pazko-jairako prestaketak egiteko eguna zen, eta judu-agintariek ez zuten nahi gorpuak larunbatez gurutzean gelditzerik, larunbat hura oso jaiegun handia baitzen. Horregatik, gurutziltzatuei berna-hezurrak hautsi eta <handik> kentzeko eskatu zioten Pilatori.
remarks: English version does not explicit SOURCE.

English: Now <in the place where he was crucified> there was a garden; and in the garden a new sepulchre, wherein was never man yet laid.
Basque: <Jesus gurutziltzatu zuten lekutik hurbil> baratze bat zegoen eta, baratzean, ordu arte inor ipini gabeko hilobi berri bat.

English: The first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and seeth the stone <taken away from the sepulchre>.
Basque: Asteko lehen egunean Magdalako Maria hilobira joan zen goizean goiz, artean ilun zegoela, eta harria <hilobitik kendua> ikusi zuen.

English: Then she runneth, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the Lord <out of the sepulchre>, and we know not where they have laid him.
Basque: Orduan, Simon Pedrorengana eta Jesusek maite zuen beste ikasleagana itzuli zen lasterka, eta esan zien: «Eraman egin dute Jauna <hilobitik>, eta ez dakigu non ipini duten».

English: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again <from the dead>.
Basque: Izan ere, ordu arte ez zuten ikasleek ulertu Liburu Santuak dioena, Jesusek <hildakoen artetik> piztu behar zuela, alegia.

English: And the other disciples came in a little ship; (for they were <not far from land>, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.
Basque: Gainerako ikasleak txalupaz joan ziren, sarea arrainekin tiraka zekartela, <lehorretik hurbil> baitziren, ehunen bat metrora.

English: This is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen <from the dead>.
Basque: Hirugarren aldia zen hau, Jesus, <hildakoen artetik> piztu ondoren, bere ikasleei agertzen zitzaiena.
